pullrequest.title: Tutorial on how Ignition finds resources at runtime

content.raw:
Thanks for the nice tutorial! 

I am not sure if this is the right place to ask for some doubts, but let’s write it here and if it is the case we can open new issues:

* If you create a  `.deb` package for a project that install some plugins/resources used by ignition-gazebo, typically you can’t automatically modify the system environment variables, so typically plugin systems also look in some hardcoded path in `/usr/<something>` to permit to load system-installed plugins without messing with environment variables. 
* Having to set 4 or 5 environment variables to deploy a \`ign-gazebo\`-using project may be a bit complex or error prone even if done with automatic setup scripts, do you think that for the future it could make sense to substitute or add to all these variables also some generic `IGN_PLUGIN_PATH` or `IGN_PREFIX_PATH` that is valid for all ignition projects? 

‌

‌
